title: Web3 Revolution Unleashed: Ethereum’s Scaling Symphony and Chainlink’s Oracle Power Unite - Crypto News Flash
content:
Chainlink, a key player, supports Ethereum’s vision by providing secure external data and off-chain computation.

The collaboration advances Ethereum’s goal of scaling, enabling more apps and a sustainable Web3 future.

Heralded as a transformative force, blockchain technology is reshaping how societies exchange value. While decentralized and trust-minimized, the technology grapples with throughput limitations. Ethereum, a prominent player in the blockchain realm with billions locked in its DeFi ecosystem, grapples with similar constraints. To conquer this challenge and enable broader accessibility, Ethereum’s community embraces an ambitious strategy, layer-2 rollups.

As a blockchain-agnostic Web3 services platform, #Chainlink supports every blockchain ecosystem's approach to scaling. In this post, we explore how Chainlink is supporting Ethereum's rollup-centric approach to scaling its ecosystem's throughput.https://t.co/OQRfP88X7t — Chainlink (@chainlink) August 23, 2023

Ethereum’s Ambitious Path to Scale

Ethereum’s inception in 2015 introduced smart contracts, revolutionizing programmable decentralized applications. However, the adoption surge increased transaction fees, raising concerns about scalability. Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin introduced a rollup-centric roadmap in 2020 to address this issue. Layer-2 rollups, involving off-chain transaction execution and on-chain data storage verified through fraud or validity proofs, gained prominence.

Rollups consolidate transaction data off-chain, enhancing throughput while maintaining on-chain security. Ethereum’s community fervently rallied behind this approach, propelling optimistic rollups, zk-rollups, and validiums to the forefront. Over $10 billion now reside within these layer-2 networks, accelerating Ethereum’s scalability vision. Upcoming upgrades like EIP-4844 (Proto-Danksharding) are poised to support this scaling strategy further, drastically lowering on-chain data submission costs.

Chainlink’s Symbiotic Role in Scaling Ethereum

Chainlink, a versatile Web3 services platform, orchestrates secure external data access, off-chain computation, and cross-chain interoperability vital to smart contract applications. It staunchly supports diverse blockchain ecosystems, aligning seamlessly with Ethereum’s scaling endeavor. Ethereum’s layer-2 rollup adoption aligns perfectly with Chainlink’s trajectory.

Since its launch on Ethereum, Chainlink has expanded across 15 blockchains, including Ethereum’s layer-2 rollups like Arbitrum, Base, and Optimism. This unity of vision and functionality cements Chainlink’s role in Ethereum’s scalability. Enhanced throughput and reduced gas costs, hallmark features of rollups, bolster Chainlink’s oracle services, enabling richer data publication and more frequent updates.

Chainlink SCALE: Catalyzing Ecosystem Growth

The collaboration deepened through Chainlink’s SCALE initiative. Designed to expedite blockchain and layer-2 ecosystem growth while bolstering Chainlink Network’s economic sustainability, SCALE covers Oracle service operating costs for participating ecosystems. This program nurtures smart contract innovation, paving the way for sustainable fee-generation models.

Ethereum layer-2 rollups like Base, Metis, Scroll, and StarkNet have joined SCALE, propelling developer activity surges. The result? Amplified data access for developers, nurturing sophisticated applications and fostering a virtuous innovation cycle. Chainlink-linked dApps, such as Gains Network and Dopex, migrating to Ethereum layer-2, have reaped adoption dividends.

Oracles and Economic Sustainability: A Two-Way Street

For Ethereum’s oracle services to thrive, economic sustainability is paramount. Layer-2 rollup-based Oracle services enjoy a head start thanks to higher throughput and lower transaction fees. Demand for these services has surged, reflecting the appetite for efficient, cost-effective solutions. Daily on-chain calls from dApps to Chainlink Data Feeds on Ethereum rollups have surged, outpacing Ethereum’s baselayer.

Aligned with Ethereum’s scaling approach, Chainlink’s Data Feeds are poised to meet this demand, anticipating increased deployment on rollups. This strategy caters to evolving usage patterns and optimizes resources, effectively advancing Chainlink’s network and the broader DeFi ecosystem.

A Multi-Rollup Future: Empowering Ethereum’s Vision

Ethereum’s trajectory toward layer-2 rollup networks promises enhanced user experiences and higher transaction throughput. Chainlink’s comprehensive oracle services fortify this journey. The multi-rollup landscape is poised to connect these networks, enabling seamless liquidity and data transfers and fostering cross-rollup smart contract applications.

The alliance between blockchain and layer-2 rollups, enriched by Chainlink’s pivotal role, underscores the evolution of Ethereum’s scalability vision. Adhering to a robust deployment strategy and nurturing economic sustainability sets the stage for a more accessible and vibrant Web3 ecosystem.

Blockchain technology’s promise meets the challenge of scalability head-on. Ethereum’s embrace of layer-2 rollups and Chainlink’s versatile oracle services form a formidable partnership, driving the growth of a more accessible Web3 landscape. These developments set the stage for a new era of blockchain scalability and innovation.

title: The September launch of Ethereum’s new Holesky Testnet - CryptoNewsZ
content:
The launch of the Holesky Testnet, which will add 1.6 Billion ethers to the network, is planned by the Ethereum development team. In order to advance the blockchain’s overall development, the Ethereum core developers emphasized that 1.4 million validators were tested for Holesky. Geth and Nethermind’s pre-launch bugs were located and fixed. The Ethereum developer also mentioned that Kurtosis Tech and the Ethereum Foundation’s DevOps team collaborated on pre-launch testing and that they want to use it to enhance test scenarios in the future. In the middle of September, Ethereum developers plan to release Holesky, a new testnet. A large number of testnet coins will be added to the testing layer in order to promote development.

Why is Holesky different?

In the world of Blockchain, Holesky stands out as a paradigm shifter thanks to its multiple innovations that cut through conventional lines. Holesky offers a game-changing solution that establishes new standards of excellence, anchored on cutting-edge research and technological capability. Holesky’s fundamental innovation is a revolutionary consensus process that makes use of the strength of verifiable computing to rethink blockchain efficiency. This innovative method is a striking departure from energy-intensive techniques, not only assures consensus correctness but also substantially lowers energy usage.

The fusion of cryptographic primitives by Holesky increases security, which is of utmost importance. Its hybrid encryption architecture ensures data privacy while facilitating easy communication. Holesky is propelled into applications that were previously thought to be unreachable for blockchain technology because of its strengthened security architecture, which fosters confidence.

Holesky also excels in the area of scale. With unprecedented scalability without sacrificing decentralization, its ground-breaking sharing technology dynamically adjusts to network needs. The ancient Byzantine Generals Problem is elegantly solved, supporting the fault tolerance and dependability of the adaptive sharding mechanisms. It also broadens accessibility beyond the world of developers by including user-friendly interfaces, encouraging wider engagement. Its developer-friendly toolbox promotes a collaborative and creative environment, drawing a variety of innovators to congregate and contribute.

What are the Key Features?

Some of the key features of Ethereum’s Holsky Testnet are provided below:

Scalability: By using verifiable computing to offload complexity, adaptive sharding for parallel processing, and an energy-efficient PoS consensus, “Holesky” skillfully addresses network congestion. “Holesky” skillfully addresses network congestion. During times of high demand, smooth operation is further guaranteed by prioritized queues and dynamic resource allocation. It is equipped to enable extraordinary transaction speed while retaining network stability thanks to its all-encompassing methodology and layered design.

Improved Consensus Mechanism: The solid security provided by Proof of Work, which is based on intricate computations, is combined with the effectiveness of Proof of Stake, which depends on the validator’s holdings. A dual-layered defense is created by this combination: PoW defends against attacks using resource-intensive puzzles, while PoS secures ethical conduct using economic stakes. As a consequence, network integrity and operational efficiency are optimized, while security is increased without using unnecessary energy.

Smart Contract Optimization: Code improvement, opcode choice, and effective state management are all necessary to optimize the smart contract execution environment. These actions improve contract efficiency and cut back on pointless computations, lowering gas expenses. Resource consumption is enhanced by using batch transactions and parallel processing.

Cutting-edge Decentralized Applications: Holesky expands its functionality to a variety of applications, most notably the avant-garde idea of an Ethereum casino . It has the potential to completely transform the online gaming sector by using its effective consensus, adaptive sharding, and verifiable computing. The Ethereum Casino serves as an example of how ‘Holesky’ improves security, scalability, and transaction speed.

Robust Developer Tools: Comprehensive documentation makes integration simple, and cutting-edge debugging tools make code optimization simple. This ecosystem promotes innovation by giving developers the resources they need to create quickly and solve problems successfully, promoting a team-based atmosphere for developing cutting-edge blockchain applications.

Realistic Network Conditions: Holesky simulates genuine network dynamics to produce realistic testing results. With the help of an innovative architecture, it incorporates variables that simulate delay and congestion in the actual world. This makes it possible for developers to evaluate performance, spot flaws, and efficiently optimize their apps.

Conclusion

A crucial turning point in the development of blockchain technology will be marked with the September launch of Ethereum’s Holesky Testnet. Holesky ushers in a new age of improved scalability, security, and developer-friendly tools with its ground-breaking capabilities, from effective consensus to creative sharding. As the launch date draws near, excitement for the revolutionary impact this testnet will have on redefining blockchain capabilities and catapulting Ethereum and its community to previously unimaginable heights of success builds.

title: Crypto news: Ripple (XRP) surpasses Ethereum in South Korea - The Cryptonomist
content:
Important crypto news for Ripple (XRP), which recently overtook Ethereum in terms of preference in South Korea, becoming the favorite altcoin of investors, according to a tweet from Whale:

XRP Surpasses Ethereum as South Korea’s Most Popular Altcoin — Whale | Dinobet.io (@WhaleChart) August 23, 2023

See below for all the details.

The Ripple (XRP) crypto triumphs over Ethereum in South Korea

As anticipated above, the fifth crypto in the global rankings, Ripple (XRP), now reigns as the favorite in South Korea in the altecoin sphere, overtaking even Ethereum.

Specifically, it is attested that Ripple (XRP) has gained the top spot among the most popular altcoins in South Korea. This report shows that South Korean cryptocurrency traders have embraced XRP as their top choice in comparison with other cryptocurrencies.

In addition, it is worth mentioning that Ripple has shown a growth of about 2% over the past few hours. South Korea-based cryptocurrency trading platform Bitsum shared a study highlighting investment trends among different age groups.

Emerging from this are traders in their 20s as the most active in the country. Moreover, the same study confirms XRP as the most sought-after cryptocurrency in this age group, with more than 20% of young people preferring this token.

There is no denying the obvious growth and development that the cryptocurrency market has experienced in recent years. And the central role played by the younger generation in the stimulating evolution of this sector is indisputable.

This generational shift in preferences eloquently demonstrates the unique features that XRP can offer.

Some data regarding the Ripple (XRP) crypto

We also see that, based on the report provided, it appears that 82.5% of investors in the 20-year age group have allocated their investments to altcoins.

Among these, Ripple stands out as the most popular altcoin, boasting a 20.7% share.

This marks a relevant triumph of Ripple on the cryptocurrency scene, even surpassing the mainstays of the industry, namely Bitcoin and Ethereum.

Although the latter are key figures in the cryptocurrency landscape, XRP’s expansion in South Korea bolsters investor confidence. We also note that several elements have fueled the meteoric growth of the Ripple ecosystem.

These include XRP’s practical uses, technological advancements, and strategic alliances. In addition, Ripple’s remarkable triumph in a legal battle against the US SEC has further solidified XRP’s position.

In making further strides, XRP experienced a considerable jump of about 60% in value immediately after the verdict in Ripple’s favor in the legal case.

Currently, Ripple’s price stands at around $0.5286, accompanied by an increase of more than 1.72% in the past 24 hours.

However, according to CoinMarketCap, there is evidence of a decline in the magnitude of daily trading volumes for XRP, registering a release of 18.29%.

SEC and XRP Conflict: Ripple’s Garlinghouse Initiative

The dispute between the US Securities & Exchange Commission (SEC) and Ripple Labs, the crypto company, continues to move forward and Brad Garlinghouse, CEO of Ripple, is further solidifying his defense.

During the day on Tuesday, two renowned attorneys from the respected law firm Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP announced their decision to participate in the litigation currently pending in the US District Court for the Southern District of New York.

Attorney Michael A. Schulman formally filed a motion for Pro Hac Vice, a legal procedure that allows a lawyer to practice in a jurisdiction where they are not licensed.

In addition, attorney Caleb J. Robertson has formally taken the position of representing Garlinghouse in the same court proceeding. The input of lawyers of such caliber from a renowned law firm underscores the significance and complexity of the case.

As is well known, the charges brought by the SEC against Garlinghouse and co-founder Chris Larsen involve the sale and issuance of the digital asset XRP.

As previously reported by U.Today, the judge overseeing the SEC’s civil case against Ripple Labs planned to begin a jury trial in the second quarter of 2024, specifically between April and June.

Although Judge Analisa Torres has previously ruled that the XRP coin does not constitute a security with regard to transactions on digital marketplaces, Ripple and its executives may still face other violations.

In fact, the SEC recently took legal action to challenge this decision, but the outcome of that attempt remains to be seen.

title: Ethereum Co-founder Vitalik Buterin Moves $1M of ETH To Coinbase - Blockzeit
content:
On Monday, August 21, Vitalik Buterin, one of the co-founders of Ethereum (ETH), was observed transferring 600 ETH, which is valued at around $1 million, into a wallet on the Coinbase exchange. Usually, transfers to exchange are translated to mean an intention to sell.

According to on-chain data from Etherscan, a wallet controlled by Vitalik Buterin transferred the assets on August 21. At the time of writing (August 23, 2023), the wallet still holds 3,933 ETH worth approximately $6.5 million.

This occurrence is not the initial instance of Buterin moving assets to a crypto exchange. In an earlier instance this year, in March, the co-founder of Ethereum transferred 200 ETH to Kraken. Around the same time, Buterin also divested several unsolicited alternative cryptos (referred to as “shitcoins”) in exchange for 439.25 ETH.

Buterin has made a series of transactions amid the recent market downturn that has been flagged by several crypto observers. On Sunday, he repaid 251,000 Rai Reflex tokens on Maker and subsequently liquidated 1,000 worth around $1.6 million according to data from lookonchain.

Ethereum Price Declined 13% After Vitalik Sold In April

Large transactions from recognized high-net-worth holders and influential figures like Vitalik Buterin often influence the markets significantly. Historical data culled from Arkham Intelligence shows how Ethereum’s price sank by 13% barely a week after Vitalik made a significant outflow in April.

As shown in the chart above, Vitalik had moved out $283 million worth of ETH on April 19. Interestingly, ETH price began to wobble within just 48 hours and later declined 13% from $2,102 to $1,840 by the close of April 25.

Also, back in 2021, Vitalik’s alternate 0Xabf address, which currently holds 248,027 ETH (~$415 million), exhibited a similar premonitory pattern.

On November 5, 2021, Vitalik moved out a total of 19.5 billion worth of ETH over an eventful period of two weeks. That period coincided with Ethereum losing its all-time high of $4,890, which it hasn’t reclaimed ever since.

Ethereum’s Price, Market Cap, and Trading Volume

Ethereum’s Price Chart: According to Coingecko

The price of Ethereum (ETH) as of the time of writing, is $1,663.22 today with a 24-hour trading volume of $5,742682,763.82. This represents a -0.53%price decline in the last 24 hours and a -9.66% price decline in the past 7 days. With a circulating supply of 120 Million ETH, Ethereum is valued at a market cap of $200,045,386,947.

title: Bitcoin Spark: Harnessing the Power of Ethereum and Bitcoin to Change the Future of Finance - Blockzeit
content:
Bitcoin Spark is gaining traction in the crypto world as it promises to revolutionize the future of decentralized finance by combining the strengths of Bitcoin and Ethereum.

Bitcoin price prediction

Bitcoin’s price observed through a four-hour timeframe reveals a bearish sentiment with a pattern of “Three Black Crows” candlesticks. The prevailing bearish dominance is emphasized by the Relative Strength Index (RSI) and Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicators moving into the oversold region. The immediate resistance is at $26,200. But, the presence of a bearish engulfing candlestick and a two-day candle pattern below this level suggests ongoing downward pressure. A continuation of this trend could propel Bitcoin’s descent to $25,600. Conversely, surpassing the $26,200 level might pave the way for targeting resistance at $26,800, subsequently opening doors for further gains toward $27,300. Nonetheless, a breach below $25,200 could signify the potential for deeper losses.

How to mine Ethereum

Mining Ethereum no longer became possible since The Merge. Ethereum transitioned from a Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus mechanism, which relies on miners, to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS), where validators are chosen to create new blocks and validate transactions based on the amount of Ethereum they hold and are willing to stake as collateral. While this transition did curb the issue of energy and speed, there are still concerns about centralization with PoS.

Bitcoin Spark

Bitcoin Spark is built on Ethereum. The project improves on the original vision of Satoshi Nakamoto, Bitcoin’s creator, introducing changes that usher in a new generation of cryptocurrency use cases. However, it does retain the favorable characteristics of Bitcoin, such as a limited supply of 21 million.

Bitcoin Spark will have increased block transaction capacity, reduced block time, and a significantly higher number of nodes than the Bitcoin blockchain. This ensures it has a higher transaction throughput while maintaining fast speeds and low costs.

Taking from its predecessor, Ethereum, Bitcoin Spark will support smart contracts. However, it takes it a step further by having a multi-layered architecture with different contract execution systems but singular network finality. This layered model ensures scalability while promoting diversity by allowing the use of multiple programming languages, both high-level and low-level. Bitcoin Spark therefore boosts its utility, establishing itself as a blockchain with diverse applications extending a simple P2P payment system.

The Bitcoin Spark network introduces a cross between Proof-of-Work (PoW) and Proof-of-Stake (PoS) known as Proof-of-Process PoP (PoP). The PoP requires miners/validators to stake and contribute processing power to the network in order to validate blocks and earn rewards. Bitcoin Spark, however, combines the PoP with a unique algorithm that reduces rewards per larger stake size and per additional power exponentially to ensure fairer distribution between larger and smaller miners. The Bitcoin Spark development team has ensured that the work and power required for mining BTCS is relatively low through the network’s native application.

The Bitcoin Spark application allows users to mine by permitting access to their mining device’s processing unit. The application can be installed on Windows, Linux, Android, iOS, and Mac OS devices and will work in an isolated virtual environment that doesn’t interfere with operating system functions to ensure security. It will also adjust the processing power used to account for overheating, battery, and simultaneous usage requirements. However, miners will have the option of manually selecting the device resources permitted for mining use. Bitcoin Spark’s innovative approach to network validation ensures true decentralization by enabling anyone to participate.

Newly minted coins are the only way to incentivize validators to participate in many blockchains. However, Bitcoin Spark changes this notion. The processing power provided by miners is ‘rented out’ to organizations or individuals as remote computing power through the Bitcoin Spark network. The clients will pay with BTCS, which will be allocated to the mining pool to supplement BTCS minting rewards. Additionally, the Bitcoin Spark application and website will have small slots for community-policied advertisements, where 50% of the revenue generated will be transferred to miners and network participants. With such diverse revenue sets, Bitcoin Spark can not only survive but thrive in a Web3 world of singular use cases and closed revenue systems.

The Bitcoin Spark Initial Coin Offering (ICO) has gained significant investments so far and is currently in Phase 3, selling BTCS at $2.00, accompanied by a 12% bonus.

Website: https://bitcoinspark.org/
